title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 April 2012 - XWiki

10:15 <+tmortagne> mflorea: could you put a few word and a screenshot maybe or your improvements to EM UI ?  
10:15 <+tmortagne> (in the release note)  
10:16 <+tmortagne> same for the new JSON velocity tool  
10:16 <+mflorea> sure, note that we have a bug.. :( a class cast exception when viewing the installed extensions  
10:17 <+mflorea> from DefaultInstalledExtension to SafeInstalledExtension, I think  
10:17 <+tmortagne> ok, will look at that, we need to start putting some functionnal test in xwiki-enterprise-test-extension  
10:18 <+tmortagne> weird that we did not get error when validating the page for xhtml  
10:18 <+tmortagne> since any error in the log or the page is supposed to fail the test I think  
10:19 <+tmortagne> ha but there is no installed extension by default that's why  
10:20 <+tmortagne> mflorea: would be nice if you  can send me the stack trace should be easy to fix, if you don't have it anymore I will try to reproduce  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <+mflorea> I think can fix it myself ;)  
10:20 <+mflorea> it's in the script service  
10:21 <+mflorea> I'll ping you if I don't manage  
10:21 <+tmortagne> ok

12:26 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* rb56ce25 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/b56ce25cd0001863d92b52c1095e179894c47db7 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Welcome.xml : XE-392: Add a Getting Started guide to XWiki Enterprise - http://git.io/I1gbpg  
12:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: can we reload translations on l10n to do this: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-392?focusedCommentId=69996#comment-69996 ? Is there a more performant way? :)  
12:35 <Rajan\_Mistry> has quit  
12:42 <audiodevelop> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <audiodevelop> Hi! My name is Sai and I am a student from India. I would like to participate in GSOC.  
12:46 <audiodevelop> I'm new to open source development, and was wondering whether I would still have a chance even though I've never worked on open source projects before  
12:48 <@cjd> you can register with the mailing lists on lists.xwiki.org and send mail to the developers' list about what project interests you  
12:49 <jssolichin> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <jssolichin|> has quit  
12:52 <audiodevelop> Well, I'm a java programmer at heart. I've been taking a look at the LDAP server implementation, it seems interesting, but I don't understand what exactly the project's main purpose is...  
12:54 <vmassol> has quit  
12:55 <audiodevelop> I've subscribed to the devs mailing list :)  
13:08 <audiodevelop> What I understand is that XWiki should be able to be used as an LDAP server. So the various entries in XWiki can then be accessed as objects (different instances) by a number of connections  
13:08 <audiodevelop> Am I correct in my understanding?  
13:10 <@cjd> No, it doesn't do LDAP serving at the moment, it will use LDAP as a backend for users. note that xwiki.org is running xwiki so you can see it work in real life.  
13:14 <Rajan\_Mistry> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <audiodevelop> Ok, so thats what the LDAP GSOC project's about, right? "...use XWiki as LDAP server for another instance of XWiki.."; to implement an XWiki LDAP as a backend for user registration and groups for XWiki?  
13:18 <jssolichin|> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <jssolichin> has quit  
13:20 <audiodevelop> @cjd thank you very much  
13:35 <audiodevelop> has quit

13:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I don't see what you mean by "reloading translation" from what I understood http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-392?focusedCommentId=69996#comment-69996 adds new pages so they need to be added to l10n first, it will not guess that there is new wiki pages to translate  
14:00 <vmassol> right.. my bad  
14:01 <+tmortagne> given the number of pages it should probably have its own application on l10n, WDYT ?  
14:02 <vmassol> there's no new page  
14:02 <vmassol> I guess htese pages are already on l10n  
14:02 <vmassol> I'll check later  
14:02 <+tmortagne> no there is no pages about a guide on l10n, only the main page and syntax page for XE  
14:03 <+tmortagne> and sandbox  
14:03 <+tmortagne> that's all  
14:03 <+tmortagne> did not even know we had a guide already  
14:03 <vmassol> no no  
14:03 <vmassol> it's only a link to the getting started guide in Main.Welcome  
14:04 <vmassol> yes the guide is on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/WebHome  
14:04 <+tmortagne> I mean in XE  
14:04 <+tmortagne> since the issue is about XE  
14:04 <+tmortagne> not xwiki.org  
14:04 <vmassol> we don't have any gettting started guide on XE  
14:04 <+tmortagne> that's what I'm saying...

17:18 <+mflorea> vmassol: is there a best practice regarding the documentation of velocity tools. For standard velocity tools it's simply, we just link the javadoc from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting#HVelocitySpecificInformation but I don't see our own tools (collection, regex) documented anywhere. I'm looking for a way to document the JSON tool, to link it from the release notes.  
17:19 <vmassol> mflorea: they shuld be documented from the Velocity Module doc  
17:19 <vmassol> since they are in the Velocity Module  
17:19 <vmassol> checking if there's aready a velocity module or not  
17:19 <vmassol> (if not we need to create it)  
17:20 <vmassol> answer: we need to create it  
17:20 <vmassol> mflorea: can you create it?  
17:20 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Velocity+Module  
17:20 <+mflorea> yes, I will  
17:20 <vmassol> thanks  
17:20 <+mflorea> bot sure what to put there, I'll manage  
17:21 <vmassol> normally it's about the api  
17:21 <vmassol> what api and how to use it with some example  
17:21 <vmassol> but you can put the minimum  
17:21 <vmassol> and just add the section about the tools  
17:21 <vmassol> (the velocity tools)  
17:21 <+mflorea> ok  
17:21 <vmassol> list them all  
17:21 <vmassol> link to their javadoc (etxernal)  
17:21 <vmassol> + add our own api doc for our tools  
17:22 <+mflorea> I will  
17:22 <vmassol> we have a few old modules like this one that we haven't documented yet on e.x.o….  
17:23 <vmassol> I should have documented this one since I introduced the velocity module ;)  
17:23 <vmassol> thanks for helping out! :)  
17:23 <+mflorea> :)  
17:29 <Rajan\_Mistry> has joined #xwiki  
17:33 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r067ab5b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/067ab5bd75c3c08718e373b28840b114549854bb / (6 files in 6 dirs): XWIKI-7683: xwiki-platform-tool-functional-test-lifecycle makes a pain to release platform - http://git.io/zgTsjg  
17:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: releasing is now a piece of cake and pleasant ride again :)  
17:34 <+mflorea> yeah!  
17:34 <vmassol> you're all going to fight to become the RM now ;)  
17:34 <+tmortagne> vmassol: except when someone  put wrong version in dependencies :D  
17:34 <vmassol> hehe  
17:35 <+tmortagne> but yes appart from this the release script is great  
17:35 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: good hob  
17:35 <+tmortagne> job  
17:35 <kalabalik> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <cjd> has quit  
17:36 <Rajan\_Mistry> Hello I am going to do my summer internship and I would like to work on Basic work flows proposed by xwiki. According to it I must know java, html, javascript and css. I know java but I am new to html, java script and css. so can anyone tell me if I am eligible for applying in this project?  
17:37 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <jssolichin|> has quit  
17:48 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Thanks  
17:48 <@sdumitriu> There's room for lots of improvements  
17:49 <+tmortagne> sure, we really need to get the REST issue fixed because right now it's unable to create properly the blog entry properly  
17:49 <Rajan\_Mistry> I am supposed to meet Anca Luca for working on Basic work flows. So when she will be available?  
17:50 <@sdumitriu> lucaa: Hear that?  
17:51 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: there is just one thing weird in the maven-release script, it's asking me the gpg passphrase I think when it create the git tag, that's the only think left to have a script doing a full stuff without asking anything  
17:51 <+tmortagne> maybe there was no way to provide the password to git ?  
17:51 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I know, in theory gpg-agent should take care of that, but I don't know why it doesn't work on the agent machine  
17:51 <+tmortagne> passphrase I mean  
17:51 <+tmortagne> ok  
17:57 <+lucaa> hello Rajan\_Mistry  
17:57 <+lucaa> (thanks sdumitriu )  
17:57 <Rajan\_Mistry> hello  
18:00 <Rajan\_Mistry> lucaa: I want to work on Basic Work flows of xwiki. I am good at understanding user interaction with software and know java too but I am new to html,css and javascript. So am I eligible for your proposed project?  
18:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
18:05 <+lucaa> from my point of view, yes, as long as you understand "how web works" (http, application server notions, java for the web, etc). The html shouldn't be that complicated, css can be minimal, it's not complicated either, javascript is a bit tougher but you can always do without  
18:07 <+lucaa> Rajan\_Mistry: you should start by downloading xwiki and playing around with it, trying to understand how data structures in xwiki work, etc, do one of the tutorials (or an application brand new of yourself) and see if anything in the mean time rings a bell wrt what workflows should mean  
18:08 <+lucaa> if you have questions (and I assume you would), my preferred way is the mailing list, since I can answer asynchronously  
18:08 <+lucaa> have you been in another GSoC before?  
18:08 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
18:08 <Rajan\_Mistry> Ya I have installed xwiki enterprise and trying to get to know it and I am applying GSOC for first time  
18:10 <+lucaa> also, picking an issue on our bugtracker and trying to fix it so that we see how you code can be a plus  
18:10 <Rajan\_Mistry> ok  
18:11 <+lucaa> what I would be interested also to see about this project is the vision: how do you think this feature would be used, some more usecases, etc  
18:12 <+lucaa> the drive of OS contribution is a very need of one's own, in general, and I think it's good propulsion  
18:12 <evalica> has quit  
18:13 <Rajan\_Mistry> and also can you tell me please how to contact via mailing list?  
18:29 <+tmortagne> Rajan\_Mistry: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists  
18:30 <Rajan\_Mistry> Thank you

20:03 <ssavi> has left #xwiki  
20:16 <kalabalik> Hello there! I will apply for the GSoC program with my own project idea and am looking for a potential mentor. My project will share some of the Wiki philosophy (especially the crowdsourcing idea) and some of the technology XWiki is using (especially HTML, CSS and JavaScript). Do you think this would be enough proximity to XWiki for you to consider my application?  
20:19 <lucaa> has quit  
20:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:38 <vmassol> has quit  
21:39 <@sdumitriu> Hey kalabalik  
21:40 <@sdumitriu> I'm not so sure, we prefer projects that are closely related to the XWiki ecosystem  
21:40 <@sdumitriu> Depends on what your idea is  
21:41 <@sdumitriu> But in general, you'll have a hard time to get your own project accepted in GSoC, not just with XWiki  
21:43 <qwebirc81267> has joined #xwiki  
22:05 <kalabalik> has left #xwiki  
22:13 <qwebirc81267> Hello friends, I was looking over the list of project and the proposal for the use of Foundation caught my eye. The integration of the trending idea of responsive web design, via foundation, is definitely interesting: balancing between usability and weight. My current plans for implementation would be: implementation of framework -> skinning Foundation to XWiki’s current design language -> optimization -> separation of codes (  
22:13 <qwebirc81267> has quit  
22:14 <jssolichin> has joined #xwiki  
22:14 <jssolichin> oops, i forgot to change my user. On the last point, I think RWD is a great idea, but it seems like some codes/information become unnecessary at different levels—eg. Layout at 2048px isn’t required on a 480px display (esp. when datas are hidden in smaller screens)—and just adds to more data being transferred, which, in my opinion, becomes strenuous with limited mobile data usage.  That being said I do agree with the RWD prin  
22:14 <jssolichin> a great idea. But I think it should be extended to match the feel of XWiki, removing it from becoming “another” generic website, and optimization based on circumstances. I was wondering, before I create a more verbose plan, whether this is of interest to the XWiki community and if there are any input on my interpretation. (About me: I’m experienced with css3, html, php & js. I’ve began use of Codeigniter and Foundation in   
22:14 <jssolichin> An example of RWD implementation and css3 can be seen at http://jssolichin.com (still a bit rough and in the works))  
22:14 <jssolichin> i apologize for the wall of text.
